pageTitle: FRB: International Asset Markets and Real Exchange Rate Volatility
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1=The weights of the domestic and foreign tradables, and , have been chosen to be 0.72 and 0.28 respectively. Depending on the exact choices for the remaining parameters, these values imply imports of 5% - 9% of total income. The average ratio of U.S. imports from Europe, Canada and Japan to U.S. GDP between 1960-2002 is 5%. However, due to the enormous growth in international trade since 1960, this value is substantially larger than 5% towards the end of the sample. Stockman and Tesar (1995) suggest that the share of tradables in the consumption basket of the seven largest OECD countries is roughly 50%. This motivates the choice of and .}
